tp:treatment-meta.mixed-citation: Silva, Jaqueline Santana Tavares Ferreira Da, Grazia, Jocelia & Barão, Kim Ribeiro Theloris costata

tp:treatment-sec.p: Diagnosis. Body yellowish; clavus and region between claval suture and radial vein brown; radial vein black; membrane of each hemelytron hyaline, brownish; scutellum with 1+1 paramedian brownish bands. Head wider than long, each mandibular plate shorter than or as long as clypeus. Prosternum sulcate; mesosternum carinate; and metasternum flat. Superior ridge of pygophore produced posteriorly, bisinuate; genital cup with superior process of dorsal rim flap-like; crown of parameres directed laterally, with dorsal and ventral processes forming a C-shape. Posterior margin of gonocoxites VIII setose; gonapophyses VIII visible, not covered by gonocoxites VIII carinate medially.

caption.p: FIGURES 24–34. Theloris costata (Thunberg) . 24 , dorsal habitus. 25 , ventral habitus. 26 , head in ventral view. 27 , meso- and metapleuron; 28–30 , pygophore in dorsal ( 28 ), posterior ( 29 ), and ventral ( 30 ) views. 31 , left paramere. 32–34 , phallus in dorsal ( 32 ), ventral ( 33 ), and lateral ( 34 ) views. Scale bars: 1, 1, 0.5, 1, 0.5, 0.5, 0.5, 0.25, 0.25, 0.25, 0.25 mm. Abbreviations: cj, conjunctiva; dr, dorsal rim; dsd, ductus seminis distalis ; p, paramere; pcj, process of conjunctiva; ph,phalloteca; sr, superior ridge; v, vesica; vr, ventral rim.

caption.p: TABLE 1. Morphometric parameters measured [mean (minimum–maximum)] are given in millimeters, followed by sample size. Abbreviations: TL, total length; HL, head length; HW, head width; IOD, interocular distance; PL, pronotal length; PW, pronotal width; SL, scutellar length; SW, scutellar width; AW, abdominal width.

FIGURES 35–37. Theloris costata (Thunberg) . 35–36 , female genital plates. 37 , female genital plates and ectodermal ducts. Scale bars = 1 mm. Abbreviations: aaf, anterior annular flange; ch, chitinelipsen; cs, capsula seminalis ; drd, ductus receptaculi distal; drp, ductus receptaculi proximal; g8, gonapophyses VIII; g9, gonapophyses IX; gc8, gonocoxites VIII; gc9, gonocoxites IX; la8, laterotergites VIII; la9, laterotergites IX; paf, posterior annular flange; va, vesicular area.

FIGURES 38–39. Occurrence maps of Steleocoris comma (Thunberg) ( 38 ) and Theloris costata (Thunberg) ( 39 ). Circles on maps represent records obtained from museum observations, whereas stars represent georeferenced crowdsourced records obtained from iNaturalist.org.
